meanings.definition: Allow the existence, occurrence, or practice of (something that one dislikes or disagrees with) without interference.
meanings.sent1: I can tolerate spicy food even though I don't like it.
meanings.sent2: She had to tolerate her brother's loud music all night.
meanings.sent3: I tried to tolerate the annoying sound of the squeaky door, but it was too much.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was a fortress that could tolerate any annoyance.
meanings.sent5: He had to tolerate the constant barking of the neighbor's dog, driving him crazy.

meanings.definition: Endure (someone or something unpleasant) with forbearance.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to tolerate the mischievous student's antics in class.
meanings.sent2: She could tolerate the cold weather during her morning run.
meanings.sent3: He tried to tolerate the itchy sweater, but eventually had to take it off.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was walking through a storm, trying to tolerate the chaos around her.
meanings.sent5: The old car could barely tolerate the rough road, shaking with every bump.
